caption: Figure 3: Accuracy of a team after discussion. A strong model (Llama 3.1 70B) paired with a weaker model (Llama 3.1 8B) leads to order dependence. Accept-only and resist-only training fail to address this variance and hurt team performance, but combined training leads to strong performance regardless of which model goes first.
description: The chart displays the impact of different training methods (base, accept-only, resist-only, and PBT) on the accuracy of two-model teams in a debate setting, showing how PBT improves team performance and reduces order dependence.

caption: Figure 4: Baseline and team performance for Base-Base, Base-Accept, and Base-PBT teams. Base-Base and Base-Accept have larger drops depending on which teammate goes first. PBT has more consistent team performance, with the rightmost green bars being most similar to the 70B solo performance.
description: The chart displays the performance of different LLM teams in a multi-agent debate setting, showing that Persuasion-Balanced Training (PBT) leads to more consistent team performance.
